attributes.action: Stop School Nursing cuts. Immediate threat to our children's health & wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details: School nursing is a team of NHS qualified nurses who are committed to delivering care to children from 5-19 - recognised in the protection of children, knowledge of child development and significantly the promotion and support of emotional health & wellbeing. Further cuts to the service would mean no school nurse support for children over the age of 11 which will have a devastating impact on the fractured society of our children’ s wellbeing particularly their emotional wellbeing post COVID.
attributes.background: Council budgets cuts present a significant risk to children, young people and their families. Cuts include no school nurse service for secondary school aged children. School nurse value is recognised in the protection of children, particularly the support of emotional wellbeing for children over 11.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about school nurses are a matter for your local health service and schools, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to provide additional funding for school nurses, if that's something you would like to happen.
